A peak Elite-rank deer with distinctive red antlers appeared in my path. Instead of drawing my sword, I simply focused my Blood Control trait on the creature’s heart.
Burst!
The stag collapsed instantly as I commanded its heart to explode from within. The technique required a decent amount of mana and precise control, but against peak Elite opponents it was now feasible.
Thud
That was immediate death...without touching it.
I moved on to the next target - a Sapphire Serpent coiled around a tree.
Same technique, same result. The creature died before it even registered the threat.
Against Transcendent-rank beasts, this instant-kill method remained somewhat difficult. Their stronger constitutions, enhanced mana resistance, and more robust circulatory systems made direct heart manipulation extremely difficult and mana-intensive.
I could still create disruptions and clots as I’d done with the yellow boar at a larger scale, but outright bursting a Transcendent heart would drain my reserves dangerously.
But for peak Elite specimens? The technique was devastatingly efficient.
Another target... Stone Badger...
I encountered a heavily armored peak Elite badger that would normally required me to fight it and to penetrate its defenses using my sword. Instead, I simply reached through its body with invisible blood manipulation and crushed its heart.
Within thirty minutes, I had eliminated eight peak Elite-rank beasts through this method, accumulating their blood and soul power without wasting time on extended fights.
The mana expenditure was manageable. My enhanced mana regeneration at high-Elite rank meant I could sustain this hunting pace for a really long time.

chapters.title: Chapter 147: The Nest Fight [1]
chapters.content:
Chapter 147: The Nest Fight [1]
I arrived back at the Thornback nest with renewed confidence, my newly advanced high-Elite rank and new aspect were reassuring. What had seemed like a gamble hours ago now felt like a manageable challenge.
"Time to clear out this infestation," I muttered with anticipation, a predatory smile forming on my face.
Unlike my previous cautious reconnaissance, I didn’t bother activating Silent Predator or suppressing my aura. There was no point in stealth when my intention was total extermination. Every spider in this nest was going to die tonight - nothing would leave this place alive.
I strode directly toward the entrance.
Pat! Pat! Pat!
Rain poured outside like the clouds could no longer hold it in.
The familiar webbed interior appeared as I crossed the threshold, but this time I wasn’t sneaking past patrols.
Almost immediately, I encountered my first targets. Three Noble-rank Thornbacks scurrying along the wall on some routine patrol or maintenance task. Their multiple eyes registered my presence, their sharp legs beginning to shift into defensive positions.
They never got the chance to attack.
Blood Control! Heart Burst!
I focused my trait on all three simultaneously, commanding their hearts to rupture from within. The technique was effortless against Noble-rank opponents - their cardiovascular systems offered virtually no resistance to my blood manipulation.
Pop! Pop! Pop!
The spiders collapsed instantly, their bodies convulsing once before going still. Blood oozed from their mouths and leg joints, pooling beneath their corpses as their circulatory systems failed catastrophically.
I continued forward without pause, leaving the intact carapaces behind. The hard exoskeletons remained completely undamaged by my internal attack method - those shells would fetch excellent prices from merchants who specialized in monster materials.
More targets ahead...
A larger group appeared as I moved deeper - ten Thornbacks of various sizes emerging from a side passage. Nine were Noble-rank workers, but one larger specimen at the front registered as mid Elite-rank, likely a patrol leader.
They detected the blood scent from my previous kills and began advancing aggressively, their sharp legs clicking against stone in coordinated rhythm.
I targeted all ten hearts simultaneously, pushing my trait to handle multiple opponents at once. The Noble-rank specimens died instantly as before, but the Elite-rank leader’s stronger constitution provided a split second of resistance.
The patrol leader managed to take half a lurching step forward before its heart ruptured completely, joining its subordinates in a spreading pool of spider blood.
"Efficient," I noted with satisfaction, already moving past the corpses.
Bursting hearts proved remarkably useful for resource harvesting. The carapaces remained pristine and undamaged, meaning I could sell them for premium prices rather than dealing with the reduced value of combat-damaged shells. The technique was both tactically effective and economically sound.
Deeper... stronger specimens...
As I penetrated further into the nest’s interior, the ambient mana density increased and the spider sizes grew noticeably larger. These were the mid-Elite and high-Elite specimens that formed the colony’s primary defence force.
A group of five appeared ahead, each one registering as mid-Elite rank with the enhanced auras of experienced combatants. Their multiple eyes reflected intelligence beyond the instinct-driven behavior of lesser specimens.
Blood Control! Execute!
I targeted their hearts with concentrated force, but these stronger spiders possessed enough constitution to resist momentarily. Their bodies convulsed violently as they fought against the internal attack.
SHRIEK! SHRIEK! SHRIEK!
Before dying, three of them managed to release piercing alarm calls that vibrated through the entire nest structure. The high-frequency sound would alert every spider in the colony to the intrusion.
It seems like the warning has been issued...Well, irrelevant.
I didn’t panic at the alarm. In fact, I welcomed it. Having all the spiders converge on my position would be more efficient than hunting them individually through the maze of passages.
Pop! Pop! Pop! Pop! Pop!
The mid-Elite Thornbacks finally succumbed to the heart rupture technique, collapsing in rapid succession as their cardiovascular systems failed. Blood pooled beneath their larger bodies in quantities that shouldn’t be wasted.
Blood Control! Harvest!
I drew the spider blood from the corpses, collecting it into storage vials. Thornback blood had unique properties - its venomous characteristics and natural anticoagulants made it valuable for certain alchemical applications and weapon enchantments.
More importantly, I could use their blood for creating blood weapons during the upcoming fight rather than depleting my existing supply of higher-quality Transcendent blood. Why waste premium resources when abundant inferior alternatives were available?
I hear them... many approaching...
The nest erupted with activity as the alarm call triggered colony-wide response. I could hear the clicking of hundreds of sharp legs against stone, the rustling of disturbed webbing, and the aggressive chittering of aroused Thornbacks converging on my position from multiple directions.
Come... all of you...
I activated my blood enhancement fully and drew my rare-rank sword, the blade gleaming with crimson energy as I prepared for the swarm assault. The collected spider blood began forming into additional weapons above my head - spears, blades, and projectiles ready to launch at my command.
My Strong Body aspect provided passive protection that would prove crucial when surrounded. My Stone Armor Echo could be activated if the pressure became overwhelming. And my various bloodline traits had proven effective against everything from Noble to Transcendent rank opponents.
The Thornback colony had survived for decades in these caves, eliminating countless adventurers who dared disturb their domain.
Tonight, that reign would end.
The first wave of responding spiders appeared from three separate passages simultaneously, easily thirty Elite-rank Thornbacks advancing with coordinated aggression born from hive-mind communication.
I smiled grimly and launched my blood weapons forward while simultaneously targeting their cardiovascular systems with internal manipulation.
The slaughter was about to begin in earnest.
The first wave crashed into my position like a tidal wave of chitin and venom. Thirty Elite-rank Thornbacks converged from multiple passages, their sharp legs clicking in synchronized rhythm as hive-mind coordination drove them forward.
SPIT! VENOM SPRAY!
Multiple spiders launched streams of corrosive liquid at me simultaneously, the large amount of yellowish venom was capable of melting through steel armor.

chapters.title: Chapter 148: The Nest Fight [2]
chapters.content:
Chapter 148: The Nest Fight [2]
I dodged the initial volleys with my speed, but the confined space made complete evasion impossible.
Splash!
Several venom streams struck my chest and arm, the corrosive substance immediately beginning to eat through clothing and reaching skin. But my newly acquired Strong Body aspect and enhanced constitution meant the damage was superficial - very subtle burning rather than the devastating flesh-melting that would affect normal opponents.
Another group fired sticky webbing projectiles designed to immobilize prey. The strands were supernaturally strong, capable of restraining even Elite-rank awakeners through sheer tensile strength.
Slash! Cut Through!
I carved through the incoming webs with my blade, the blood energy coating my sword burning through the sticky material before it could properly bind me. A few strands managed to catch my left leg, but I simply tore through them.
I targeted ten spiders simultaneously, commanding their hearts to rupture from within. The technique was becoming almost effortless with practice and my increased rank.
Pop! Pop! Pop!
The targeted Thornbacks convulsed and died, their bodies creating obstacles that disrupted the advance of those behind them. But more kept coming - the colony’s numbers seemed endless.
Rather than let the spider blood pool uselessly, I activated my Blood Control trait to draw their essence to create more weapons. The inferior blood couldn’t match Transcendent-quality resources, but quantity had its own advantages.
The spider blood reformed into deadly projectiles above my head - dozens of crystallized blood spears that would cost enormous mana if created from my personal reserves. But using the enemies’ own blood as ammunition? That was resource-efficient.
The blood spears shot forward like a crimson rain, each one targeting vital points on approaching spiders. The projectiles punched through exoskeletons with devastating force, creating a barrier of impaled corpses between me and the next wave.
I reached for the artifact hanging around my neck and channelled blood into its enchantments. The pendant’s unique ability allowed me to burn blood as fuel for enhanced power - and I had abundant fuel available from dozens of spider corpses.
BURN! Power Surge!
The pendant flared with brilliant red light as it consumed spider blood like a furnace consuming coal. My physical capabilities spiked beyond even my blood enhancement’s normal output. Strength, speed, and durability all increased as the artifact converted biological material into raw power.
Each sword strike carved through multiple spiders, each movement left afterimages, and each defensive position became an impenetrable fortress.
Slash! Decapitate Three!
My blade moved so fast, severing heads from bodies in sweeping arcs that left no room for counterattack.
Blood Spear! Mass Launch!
More projectiles formed from harvested blood and launched continuously, creating a rhythm of death that the spiders couldn’t penetrate. For every one that fell, its blood became ammunition for killing two more.
SHRIEK! ATTACK! OVERWHELM!
The spiders attempted coordinated rushes from multiple angles, trying to use their numbers to drag me down through sheer mass. Dozens of sharp legs struck at my position, venomous bites sought exposed flesh, and sticky webs tried to bind my movements.
Strong Body! Absorb Impacts!
My passive defensive aspect proved its worth as attacks that should have pierced skin merely left bruises. Bites that should have injected lethal venom were absorbed by my enhanced constitution. The spiders were discovering that I was far more durable than any prey they’d encountered before.
Counterattack! Devastating Response!
Every failed spider attack created openings that I exploited ruthlessly. A bite attempt became a severed head. A leg strike became a burst heart.
A web launch became impalement by blood spear.
Fifty dead... seventy... ninety...
The body count climbed rapidly as I eliminated everything that entered the central chamber. Elite-rank Thornbacks ranging from newly low rank specimens to peak-level. They all fell before me like swarms of flies.
The confined space that should have been my disadvantage became a killing field. Where warriors would be overwhelmed by attacking from all angles, I thrived on the density of targets. More enemies meant more blood to harvest, more fuel for my pendant, and more opportunities.
Nearly one hundred dead... where are the leaders? Are they planning to just watch?
The swarm was thinning noticeably now. The initial wave of Elite-rank defenders had been decimated, their bodies creating a literal carpet of corpses and pooled blood that made footing treacherous for anything trying to advance.
Then I felt them - three powerful auras approaching from the nest’s deepest chambers.
SHRIEK! SHRIEK! SHRIEK!
The three Transcendent-rank Thornbacks finally arrived, their massive forms appearing at the chamber’s far entrance. These were the alpha specimens I’d observed during my initial scouting, each one twice the size of Elite specimens, with battle-scarred exoskeletons and eyes that burned with fury.
They surveyed the massacre with what could only be described as shock and rage. Nearly a hundred of their colony lay dead in minutes, slaughtered by a single intruder.
I looked at the three arrivals with a blood-splattered smile, my sword dripping with spider blood and my aura blazing like a crimson beacon.
"Took you long enough, I was starting to think you weren’t going to show up to your own extinction party."
The mockery enraged the Transcendent Thornbacks beyond rational thought which was exactly what I intended.
All three launched themselves at me simultaneously, their combined fury promising that the real fight was finally beginning.
There were approximately fifteen Elite-rank spiders remaining from the initial swarm, scattered throughout the chamber and passages. When they witnessed the three Transcendent alphas launching their furious charge, the survivors immediately joined the assault with renewed aggression.
The Transcendent Thornbacks led the coordinated assault, their massive forms thundering across the corpse-strewn floor while the Elite survivors followed in supporting positions. The combined force represented the colony’s final desperate defence - everything they had left to throw at the intruder who had massacred their numbers.
The three Transcendent specimens moved with terrifying coordination. The largest took point position, its battle-scarred carapace acting as a battering ram. The other two flanked wide, attempting to surround my position while the Elite survivors swarmed from multiple angles.

chapters.title: Chapter 149: Total Annihlation
chapters.content:
Chapter 149: Total Annihlation
I didn’t wait for them to reach me. Taking the initiative was crucial when facing multiple Transcendent opponents and Elite support simultaneously.
My blood enhancement surged to maximum output, every muscle fiber flooded with more power as I launched myself forward to meet their charge head-on. The Crimson Moon Pendant burned even brighter, consuming spider blood at an accelerated rate to fuel abilities beyond my normal limits.
The largest Transcendent crashed toward me like a living battering ram, its massive carapace gleaming with natural Armor that had turned aside countless weapons. Behind it, the two flanking alphas spread wide while Elite survivors rushed in to fill gaps and create overwhelming pressure.
I targeted the lead Transcendent with a devastating sword strike, my enhanced blade carving through one of its forward legs. The limb separated cleanly, spraying ichor across the stone floor as the creature stumbled from the sudden imbalance.
Slash! Severed!
Before it could recover, I pivoted and drove a blood spear through another leg joint, further destabilizing its charge. The massive spider crashed sideways into the chamber wall, creating an opening I exploited immediately.
The Elite survivors attempted to capitalize on my committed position, launching venomous projectiles and web attacks from multiple directions simultaneously. Their attack was admirable, attacking from angles that should have been impossible to defend.
’Null Strike.’
The sphere of absolute negation erupted around me precisely as the attacks converged. Venom streams, sticky webs, and physical strikes simply ceased to exist upon entering the technique’s radius. The spiders recoiled in confusion as their coordinated assault was negated entirely.
I used the momentary disruption to eliminate five Elite specimens with rapid heart burst techniques, their bodies dropping instantly as I continued moving, constantly repositioning to prevent them from landing an effective attack.
The second Transcendent alpha attempted a sweeping leg strike designed to knock me off balance while its companion prepared a venomous bite attack. The combination would have worked against other opponents, forced to dodge one attack directly into the other.
Instead, I activated my Stone Armor Echo, the defensive coating spreading across my body just as the leg strike connected. The impact that should have shattered bones barely knocked me sideways, and I used the momentum to spin and deliver a devastating counterstrike.
CRACK!
My blood-enhanced blade punched through the Transcendent’s natural armor, carving deep into its thorax and creating catastrophic internal damage.
SHRIEK!
The shriek of pain echoed through the chamber as vital fluids sprayed from the massive wound.
Three more Elite spiders died to blood spear projectiles as I continued the relentless assault, their bodies adding to the growing carpet of corpses. The survivors were beginning to show hesitation, their hive-mind recognizing that this fight wasn’t going according to their plan.
The third Transcendent alpha, seeing its companions injured, attempted to retreat and regroup. I couldn’t allow them to withdraw, letting them escape would just prolong the extermination.
I launched a massive blood tentacle formed from the harvested spider blood on the floor. The tentacle wrapped around the retreating Transcendent’s rear legs. The creature thrashed violently, but I channelled more mana through the blood manipulation to drag it back into combat range.
Once it was within range, my sword found its eyes, blinding the creature with precise strikes that left it disoriented and vulnerable.
I continued with a follow-up attack that targeted the joint where its head connected to its body, carving through the natural armor with blood-enhanced cutting power that came from the rare-rank weapon
Whoosh!
The third Transcendent’s head separated from its body, the massive corpse collapsing with ground-shaking impact.
One alpha down, two remaining, and seven Elite survivors still attempting futile attacks.
The injured Transcendent from my initial assault tried to compensate for its severed legs by using venomous spray attacks, coating the entire chamber with corrosive liquid that hissed and bubbled against stone.
The enclosed space made complete evasion impossible.
My Strong Body aspect and enhanced constitution absorbed the damage that penetrated my defenses. The venom burned, but it didn’t incapacitate or slow me meaningfully.
I closed distance with the injured Transcendent and activated Blood Control with lethal precision, targeting not its heart but the major blood vessels feeding its brain. The technique created artificial stroke effects that disrupted its coordination completely.
The creature’s legs buckled as neurological function failed, its body betraying it at the worst possible moment. My blade found its throat, then its heart, ending its existence with brutal efficiency.
Two Transcendent alphas eliminated. One remaining, along with seven increasingly desperate Elite specimens.
The final Transcendent recognized it was alone against an opponent who had just massacred nearly its entire colony. Instead of retreating, it committed to a suicidal final charge, channeling every bit of its bloodline power into devastating attacks.
Venomous spray mixed with physical strikes and web attacks in a combination assault that would have overwhelmed most Transcendent-rank opponents. The spider fought with the desperate fury of a creature that knew death was inevitable but refused to go quietly.
I met its charge with equal intensity, my enhanced abilities operating at absolute peak.
Every sword strike carved through chitin and flesh.
Every blood spear found vital targets.
Every defensive position utilized my high durability to absorb attacks that would kill lesser warriors.
Slash!
The final Transcendent’s head separated from its body mid-charge, its massive corpse sliding across blood-slicked stone to crash against the chamber wall. The impact sent tremors through the entire nest structure.
The seven remaining Elite spiders broke formation completely, their hive-mind recognizing total defeat. They scattered in different directions, attempting to flee deeper into the nest or escape to the surface.
I couldn’t allow survivors.
Witnesses meant the colony might be reestablished, and incomplete extermination meant wasted effort.
My blood spears hunted them down, each projectile guided by my blood trail trait to find targets even when they tried to hide in side passages or beneath webbing.
Heart burst techniques eliminated those that managed to get further away, their cardiovascular systems rupturing from invisible manipulation.
Final kill...
The last Elite Thornback died attempting to climb toward an upper tunnel, its heart exploding mid-escape as my Blood Control reached out and ended its existence.
Silence finally descended on the chamber. The only sounds were my own breathing and the dripping of blood from hundreds of corpses scattered throughout the nest’s passages.
Total extermination has been achieved with every spider eliminated.
The Thornback colony that had dominated these caves for a long time was now extinct, their final moments spent in futile resistance against an opponent whose capabilities exceeded anything their evolutionary experience had prepared them for.
I deactivated my Crimson Moon Pendant, conserving what remained of the harvested blood for future use.
My enhancements began settling back to normal levels, though the adrenaline and satisfaction of successful combat kept my senses sharp.
Now came the tedious but profitable work of harvesting materials.
With the spiders dead and silence finally settling over the gore-strewn nest, I retrieved my communication crystal and channelled mana to establish a secure connection. After several moments, a familiar voice answered.
"Young Master Blackwood. How may I assist you?"
I recognized the voice, one of my family’s senior operatives stationed in the capital. The man was discreet, efficient, and knew better than to ask unnecessary questions about orders he was given.
"I need an excavation team prepared immediately. Full resource harvesting operation, specialized in monster materials extraction."
"Understood. What scale are we discussing, young master?"
"Approximately one hundred Elite-rank Thornback corpses, including three Transcendent specimens. Complete nest extermination in the eastern hunting grounds, sector seven."
There was a brief pause as Marcus processed the magnitude of what I’d just reported. To his credit, his voice remained professionally neutral when he responded.
"That’s... quite the number of beasts, young master. I’ll assemble a team of experienced harvesters immediately. They’ll need proper equipment for Thornback carapace extraction and venom collection. I will arrange for secure transport wagons."
"Good. Also send guards, at least two Transcendent-rank to secure the perimeter. The nest is cleared, but I don’t want scavengers or opportunistic hunters claiming materials that belong to the Blackwood family."
"Of course. The team will arrive within an hour with full security detail. Anything else required?"
"Discretion. This operation doesn’t need to attract unnecessary attention from rival families or anyone else."
"Understood completely, young master. Consider it handled."
I terminated the connection and surveyed the massacre surrounding me.
The night’s hunting had been extraordinarily profitable, and the monetary returns would be substantial once these materials reached market.
I waited at the area for the next hour, killing any beast that came within the perimeter of the cave. Monsters in the area were accustomed to the smell of blood, and with the river of blood that I left in the cave, it was no wonder that the cave attracted many beasts, searching for an opportunity.
By the time the team arrived, there was nearly twenty beast carapaces outside the cave, although they were nothing crazy. Just a few low elite-rank beasts and some mid-elite beasts.

chapters.title: Chapter 150: Hotel
chapters.content:
Chapter 150: Hotel
I removed my mask and stored it carefully, resuming my normal appearance as Adrian Blackwood. There was no point maintaining my alternate identity with family subordinates, just in case. I wanted this identity to be completely free from my own identity with no ties.
The sound of approaching footsteps and equipment echoed from the cave entrance, multiple individuals moving.
"Young Master Blackwood?" A commanding voice called out.
"In here," I replied calmly.
The excavation team entered the main chamber, led by a Transcendent-rank captain whose disciplined bearing marked him as professional security. Behind him, a dozen specialized harvesters carried equipment designed for monster material extraction, while additional guards maintained perimeter positions.
The captain stepped into the chamber and froze completely.
His eyes swept across the massacre before him - hundreds of spider corpses carpeting the floor, walls splattered with blood and ichor, the massive bodies of three Transcendent Thornbacks dominating the space. The sheer scale of carnage was overwhelming even for someone with his combat experience.
What made his shock even more profound was the obvious fact that only I stood among the dead.
There was no other bodies, no sign of additional combatants. Just a single young man waiting calmly in the aftermath of total extermination.
The captain’s face showed transparent confusion and dawning realization as he processed the implications. His gaze moved from the corpses to me , then back to the corpses, clearly struggling to reconcile what he was witnessing with what should have been possible.
"Young master..." he began, his voice carrying obvious disbelief. "Did you...never mind."
I walked over and patted him on the shoulder with a casual gesture. "Take care of everything, Captain. Harvest what’s valuable, secure what needs preservation, and dispose of the rest appropriately."
The captain’s expression shifted immediately to one of profound reverence. He straightened his posture and saluted, any trace of scepticism replaced by awed respect.
"Yes, Young Master! It will be handled with utmost efficiency!"
This wasn’t just some random awakener giving orders.
This was the young master of the Blackwood family - the sole inheritor, the future Duke who would someday command their entire duchy. And he had just demonstrated capabilities that would make experienced Transcendent warriors look inadequate by comparison.
The captain turned to his team and began issuing rapid commands, his voice carrying the authority of someone who understood exactly how significant tonight’s operation was.
With the excavation team handling the material harvest, I left the cave and made my way back toward the city. Once I was certain no prying eyes could observe me, I retrieved my mask and placed it back on, resuming the anonymous identity that allowed me to move freely without drawing attention to the Blackwood heir.
The night’s work had been extraordinarily successful. My power had increased dramatically through multiple rank advancements and soul power absorption.
The new Strong Body aspect provided constant defensive enhancement that would prove invaluable in future combat.
The blacksmithing materials from Transcendent beasts - bones, tendons, carapaces, represented resources that money couldn’t easily buy. And the monetary returns from selling processed Thornback materials would generate substantial wealth for the family coffers.
More money was never something to reject, even as the son of a Duke. Wealth translated to influence, resources, and opportunities that pure combat strength alone couldn’t provide. The excavation team would convert tonight’s massacre into tangible financial gains that could fund future projects and acquisitions.
As I walked through the darkened forest paths, my thoughts turned to my father’s mission. I retrieved the Book of Hints from my storage and opened it carefully, focusing my intent on his current status.
New text materialized across the page:
Duke Marcus Blackwood continues travel toward Thornhaven. Combat encounters with scouting beasts eliminated efficiently. Royal-rank footwork technique integration progressing well. Physical condition: excellent. Morale: determined.
Probability of survival: 62%
A genuine smile formed on my face beneath the mask. The survival chance had increased by three percentage points since my last check. That meant my father was actively strengthening himself during the journey, likely through his continued practice with the Royal-rank secret art.
Sixty-two percent wasn’t perfect, but it represented a dramatic improvement from the original five percent death sentence. My intervention had mattered, transforming an impossible situation into one with realistic survival odds.
’Keep getting stronger, Father,’ I thought. ’Come back alive.’
Once inside the city walls, I made my way back toward the academy through the quieter late-night streets.
As I approached the district near the academy gates, my enhanced senses detected two familiar presences ahead. My eyes landed on Kyle and Seraphina standing near the entrance to one of the upscale establishments that catered to wealthy students and young nobles.
They both looked noticeably drunk - not stumbling or incoherent, but carrying the relaxed posture and slightly unfocused gazes that indicated significant alcohol consumption. Given their Elite-rank constitutions and awakened abilities, getting genuinely intoxicated wasn’t easy. It required deliberately suppressing their natural immunity systems to allow the alcohol’s effects to take hold, which meant they’d gone deliberately heavy with their drinking.
My eyes crossed with Kyle’s for a brief moment. I caught the subtle smirk that formed on his face - calculated and deliberate rather than the loose expression of genuine drunkenness.
Without breaking eye contact with me, Kyle casually grabbed Seraphina’s waist and guided her toward a nearby hotel entrance. The gesture was possessive and theatrical, clearly performed for my benefit rather than genuine romantic intent.
I looked at the scene with cold indifference, my expression remaining completely neutral. The transparent attempt at provocation was almost amusing in its childishness.
Kyle was obviously trying to antagonize me by taking my former fiancée to a hotel directly in front of my eyes. The psychological warfare was crude but targeted - attempting to trigger jealousy, anger, or some emotional response that would compromise my judgment.
Ignoring the manufactured scene before me, I continued walking toward the academy without pause or reaction. My pace didn’t change, my expression didn’t shift, and I gave no indication that Kyle’s performance had registered as anything beyond mildly tedious background noise.

chapters.title: Chapter 151: Exam Results
chapters.content:
Chapter 151: Exam Results
It seemed the pressure I’d been applying through consistent victories and demonstrated superiority wasn’t sitting well with the protagonist. Kyle usually maintained his composed, heroic demeanor with everyone - but those he felt genuinely threatened by received this kind of juvenile provocation instead.
Trying to antagonize me by flaunting possession of something I had voluntarily discarded was... funny, actually. The old Adrian had been obsessed with Seraphina, making a fool of himself through transparent pursuit. Whilst I had broken that engagement without hesitation and never looked back.
Kyle was attempting psychological warfare using ammunition that had lost all its power the moment I’d awakened and transformed. He was fighting a version of me that no longer existed, which meant his tactics were fundamentally flawed from the start.
The tension between us was clearly escalating beyond simple academic rivalry. Kyle recognized me as a genuine threat to his position and narrative, and this crude display was his opening move in what would likely become increasingly direct confrontation.
But if he thought taking my discarded ex-fiancée to a hotel would somehow shake my composure or cloud my judgment, he had severely miscalculated who he was dealing with.
I had Transcendent beasts to hunt, businesses to manage, and approaching doom to prepare for. Kyle’s performances barely registered as distractions worth acknowledging.
The next day arrived with my usual morning routine, though I felt noticeably stronger after the previous night’s extensive soul power absorption. Classes proceeded normally until Instructor Sylvia’s afternoon session, where I noticed an unusually large stack of papers on her desk.
The examination results had arrived.
Sylvia waited for everyone to settle before addressing the class with an expression that mixed approval with mild surprise.
"I’ve reviewed your written examination results, and I must say you’ve all performed surprisingly well. It’s quite shocking, actually, given that this was a comprehensive surprise test covering extensive material."
She paused for effect, scanning the room before delivering the most important news.
"First, I’m pleased to announce that everyone in this class has passed the examination. This means that when the end of the month approaches, you will all be receiving your standard monthly allocation of 100,000 points."
The classroom erupted in excited murmurs and relieved expressions. Even students who had been worried about their performance relaxed visibly at the confirmation that they’d met minimum standards.
Elen’s face lit up with obvious relief and satisfaction. Given her family’s financial struggles, that monthly point allocation was crucial for both her development and her ability to support her father.
Sylvia raised her hand for silence before continuing. "Additionally, the top three performers will receive bonus rewards of 10,000 points each for their exceptional rankings."
The atmosphere shifted immediately to competitive tension as everyone wondered who had claimed the top positions.
"In third place," Sylvia announced, "we have Marcus Ironhold."
The result was met with understanding nods - Marcus was known for his approach and solid academic foundation. His Ironhold family emphasized comprehensive education alongside combat training.
Marcus accepted the recognition with his characteristic calm composure, showing neither excessive pride nor false modesty.
"In second place," Sylvia continued, "Adrian Blackwood."
I maintained a neutral expression as several classmates glanced my way with mixed reactions. Some looked unsurprised given my recent combat achievements, while others seemed to reassess their understanding of my capabilities. Being a monster in combat was one thing, but excelling in theory demonstrated well-rounded development.
Sylvia paused deliberately before announcing the final ranking, building anticipation.
"And in first place... Elen Brightwater."
The classroom fell into shocked silence.
Everyone turned to stare at Elen, whose face showed genuine surprise mixed with pride. She clearly hadn’t expected to claim the top position, especially against competitors like myself and Marcus.
The shock was understandable. While Elen was respected for her alchemy knowledge and water manipulation abilities during the examination, most students had underestimated her academic capabilities. She’d maintained a relatively low profile compared to the more prominent combat-focused students, like myself, emmet and Marcus.
But the results spoke clearly - she had outperformed both me and Marcus on comprehensive theoretical knowledge, demonstrating mastery that exceeded even the strongest combat specialists in our class.
"It seems we’ve all been underestimating certain people," one student muttered loud enough to be heard.
"Elen’s not just good at alchemy," another whispered. "She’s our class’s scholar."
I caught Elen’s eye and offered a subtle nod of acknowledgment. Her academic excellence was well-deserved, and honestly, if I hadn’t been copying her answers during portions of the exam, my score would have been noticeably lower.
The irony wasn’t lost on me - I’d used her superior knowledge to secure second place, while she’d earned first through pure capability.
After class ended, Emmet approached while Elen and I were walking together discussing the examination results.
What surprised me more was that instead of ignoring Elen as he usually did, he spoke two simple words.
"Well done."
A smile formed on my face at the unexpected gesture. For Emmet, who rarely acknowledged anyone beyond combat challenges, offering congratulations was practically effusive praise.
Elen, who had grown accustomed to his aloof behaviour, looked genuinely shocked by the recognition. She recovered quickly and responded with sincere warmth.
"Thank you. You did well too, Emmet."
Emmet nodded in acknowledgment before turning his attention to me with his typical directness.
"Spar."
I nodded without hesitation. "Let’s go."
The sparring session proceeded as usual, drawing substantial crowds of spectators eager to watch two of the Elite class’s strongest students test themselves against each other. Emmet fought with his usual aggressive intensity, though I noticed he was incorporating more defensive techniques - perhaps learning from his loss against Seraphina.
The match ended without clear victor, both of us calling it off after some time.
Afterward, I walked with Elen toward the training facility section to book our respective practice rooms. Surprisingly, Emmet joined us rather than departing immediately as he typically would.
The three of us approached the booking station together - an unusual trio that drew curious glances from other students.

chapters.title: Chapter 152: Level 4 Blood Control!
chapters.content:
Chapter 152: Level 4 Blood Control!
"Blacksmithing room, two hours," I requested, preparing to continue my crafting projects.
[-2,000 Points]
"Alchemy room, two hours," Elen said, clearly planning to capitalize on her recent academic success with additional practice.
[-2,000 Points]
"Standard training room with combat dummy, two hours," Emmet stated simply.
[-1,000 Points]
The attendant processed our bookings efficiently, assigning us adjacent facilities in the same corridor. We walked together toward our respective rooms, the silence comfortable rather than awkward.
"See you in two hours?" Elen suggested as we reached her alchemy room entrance.
"Sure," I agreed.
Emmet grunted acknowledgment before disappearing into his training space without further commentary.
I entered my blacksmithing facility and immediately began setting up materials for my next project, satisfied with how the day had developed despite Kyle’s juvenile provocations the previous night.
Four hours passed in focused training rather than the two I’d initially booked. The additional time cost more points, but the investment proved worthwhile as I systematically worked through skill refinement, secret art practice, and bloodline trait development.
During an intense Blood Control exercise, a familiar notification pulsed through my consciousness.
[Your Blood Control trait has reached level 4]
The advancement was immediately noticeable. My manipulation precision increased dramatically - I could now control blood at distances I’d previously struggled with, form more complex constructs with less concentration, and execute techniques that had required significant effort with relative ease. More importantly, my fundamental understanding of blood itself had deepened. I could sense its composition, detect subtle variations in quality, and manipulate its properties in ways that transcended simple physical control.
Curious about how my accumulated improvements had affected overall combat effectiveness, I decided to test against the training dummy one final time.
I activated all my enhancements - blood manipulation, supernatural physique, the new level 4 Blood Control - and delivered a maximum power strike combined with blood weapon projection.
IMPACT! Measurement...
[TOTAL DAMAGE OUTPUT: 36,250]
I stared at the number in genuine surprise. My previous maximum which had been recorded just a few days ago, had been 24,725 combat units, which had placed me at low Transcendent equivalent power. This new result of 36,250 represented a massive leap - nearly a 50% increase in raw combat effectiveness.
The combination of trait advancement, accumulated soul power from the Thornback massacre, rank progression to high-Elite, and the Strong Body aspect had synergized into exponential rather than linear improvement.
I was now operating at mid-Transcendent equivalent combat power while still technically being at high-Elite rank - not even peak Elite yet. The gap between my official rank and actual capabilities continued widening through my optimization of every advantage.
A satisfied smile formed on my face. This level of power meant I could now engage genuine mid-Transcendent opponents on relatively equal footing, and lower Transcendent threats were essentially guaranteed victories.
Once my training session concluded, I cleaned up and exited the facility. Emmet and Elen were waiting outside their respective rooms as we’d agreed.
"Good session?" Elen asked, noting my satisfied expression.
"Productive," I confirmed simply.
Emmet grunted acknowledgment, which I’d learned to interpret as his version of approval.
After brief conversation, I excused myself from their company with a plausible excuse about needing to handle administrative matters. Emmet departed without comment, while Elen headed toward the dormitories.
I made my way toward Instructor Sylvia’s office, my purpose clear and focused.
It was time to bring Kael into the academy through the special admission process I’d been planning. My accumulated points and top-ranked status provided the leverage necessary to sponsor an exceptional candidate, and Kael’s development over the past weeks had prepared him adequately for the assessment requirements.
I reached Sylvia’s office and knocked firmly on the door, preparing to navigate whatever bureaucratic procedures were necessary to execute this next phase of my plans.
-----------
"Come in," Sylvia’s voice called from within her office.
I entered to find her reviewing what appeared to be student performance reports, her desk organized with characteristic precision. She looked up and her expression showed mild surprise at the late visit.
"Adrian. What brings you here at this hour?"
"I want to sponsor a student for special admission to the academy," I stated directly, seeing no point in elaborate preamble.
Sylvia sighed heavily and set down her papers, her expression shifting to one of resigned understanding.
"I heard from the Commander that you somehow discovered points can be utilized for such purposes. That information isn’t exactly advertised to first-year students." Her tone carried both disapproval at the leaked information and acknowledgment that I’d found it regardless.
As my homeroom teacher, she had access to detailed records of my point accumulation and expenditures. She clearly understood I possessed substantial resources despite being relatively new to the academy.
"Let’s go straight to the point," she continued. "The candidate must have absolutely no criminal record. If any criminal history exists, the sponsorship price becomes something even you cannot afford, regardless of your recent examination winnings."
I nodded calmly. "He has no criminal record."
The incident where Kael had accidentally killed Tom during self-defense had been thoroughly covered by my self. Official records showed Tom’s death as an unfortunate accident inside the orphanage.
"Secondly," Sylvia continued, "the candidate must pass an entrance examination. If he fails, you will still be required to pay the sponsorship points without him gaining admission. Alternatively, you can pay significantly higher fees to bypass examination requirements entirely, but even with your accumulated wealth, you don’t possess that amount - not even if you’d saved every point you’ve ever earned."
"I understand. The candidate will take the examination," I confirmed.
Sylvia pulled out official forms and began preparing the necessary documentation. "Very well. I’ll need complete details about this candidate - full name, background, current capabilities, and reasons for seeking special admission outside normal enrollment periods."
I provided the identity information carefully. "His name is Kael Rivermist. Orphan background, recently awakened with ice-affinity bloodline. He is currently training independently but showing exceptional potential that would benefit from academy resources."

chapters.title: Chapter 153: Kael’s admission
chapters.content:
Chapter 153: Kael’s admission
The surname "Rivermist" was entirely fabricated, a generic name my father’s people had created specifically to avoid connection with the Blackwood family. Official documentation supported the orphan background story, and nothing in the records indicated any relationship to our duchy.
Sylvia recorded the information without visible suspicion. "Kael Rivermist. And his current rank?"
"Elite rank. Newly advanced but with solid fundamentals."
"The examination will be comprehensive - combat assessment, theoretical knowledge, and magical aptitude evaluation. When would you like to schedule this?"
"As soon as possible. Within the next few days if the academy can accommodate it."
Sylvia made notes on her forms. "I’ll coordinate with the examination committee. The sponsorship fee is 300,000 points, payable now regardless of examination outcome. Are you certain you want to proceed?"
"Yes."
[-300,000 Points]
The substantial deduction registered, but I’d anticipated the cost. Kael’s admission was worth the investment for multiple reasons beyond mere point value.
"The examination will be scheduled within three days. I’ll send notification through your communication crystal with specific time and location. Your candidate should be prepared for rigorous testing across all disciplines."
"He will be ready."
Sylvia stamped the official documentation and filed it appropriately. "Is there anything else?"
"No. Thank you for accommodating this, Instructor."
She nodded dismissively, already returning to her previous work. I exited the office satisfied that the process was underway.
Now I just needed to inform Kael that his academy admission examination was imminent.
--
As I made my way back to my dormitory, the familiar notification pulsed through my consciousness indicating my daily reward had become available.
[Daily Login Available!]
[Would you like to claim your daily reward?]
I pressed yes without hesitation, curious what the system would provide after the recent string of valuable acquisitions.
[Congratulations! You have received: Bloodline Evolution Card]
A card materialized in my hand, its surface shimmering with iridescent colors that seemed to shift and flow like living aurora. The moment I touched it, information flooded into my mind.
[Bloodline Evolution Card]
[Rank: ???]
[Details: This card can evolve the bloodline of any being. The bloodline rank must be below Mythical rank. The card can be used on self or others. Single use only. Cannot be stopped once activated.]
I stared at the card in genuine shock, my mind racing through the implications of what I was holding. This wasn’t just a powerful item - this was potentially world-changing depending on how it was utilized.
Immediately, multiple candidates appeared in my thoughts. I could use it on my parents, elevating their bloodlines to higher tiers and dramatically increasing their combat potential. But that seemed excessive and would raise questions about the source of such a miraculous transformation.
I could use it on Kojiro, elevating whatever bloodline traits he possessed and making him an even more formidable guardian. That had genuine tactical merit.
Or... the egg.
I carefully retrieved the mysterious egg from my storage space, its swirling colors as mesmerizing as always.
[Mysterious Egg]
[Rank: King]
[Details: Mysterious egg of an unknown species containing a beast that can reach King rank at maturity.]
While the egg’s maximum potential was King rank, already extraordinary, that didn’t necessarily mean its bloodline was at the absolute peak. Supreme rank bloodlines like my vampire heritage were almost non-existent and the limits were certainly not king-rank. The egg’s creature likely possessed Legendary or Mythical-rank bloodline heritage.
If the bloodline was Legendary rank, the Evolution Card would upgrade it to Mythical - a substantial improvement that would enhance the hatched creature’s capabilities. If the bloodline was already Mythical, the card simply wouldn’t activate and I could save it for another candidate.
Testing it on the egg seemed like the optimal strategy. Either I’d enhance an already powerful companion to even greater heights, or I’d confirm the creature possessed maximum bloodline potential and could consider other uses for the card.
With my decision made, I activated the Bloodline Evolution Card. The crystalline surface began glowing intensely as magical energy gathered.
A prompt appeared in my consciousness:
[Select target: Self or Other]
I focused my intent on the egg held in my other hand.
[Target: Mysterious Egg]
The card dissolved into pure light that flowed like liquid toward the egg’s surface, wrapping around it in spiraling patterns of brilliant illumination that made me shield my eyes against the intensity.
The transformation had begun.
The moment the light from the dissolved card made contact with the egg’s surface, I felt something profound happening. The transformation wasn’t subtle or gradual - it was immediate and dramatic.
Pulse! Expand!
The egg began growing rapidly, its size increasing at a visible rate that made me take several steps back to give it space. Mana started radiating outward in powerful waves that distorted the air around it, creating ripples of energy that made my enhanced senses tingle with recognition of enormous power being channeled.
Flare! Surge! Intensify!
Luckily, I was inside my private dormitory room rather than a public space. The magical disturbance would have been impossible to explain to curious onlookers or concerned instructors. The privacy wards I’d activated earlier contained most of the energy signature, though I could feel them straining against the pressure.
The egg continued expanding until it reached twice its original size - now roughly the dimensions of a large watermelon rather than the melon-sized object I’d been carrying. The swirling colors across its surface became dramatically more vibrant, the purples deeper, the crimsons brighter, the golds more lustrous, and the blues more intense.
Connection... forming...
But what truly shocked me was the sudden sensation of a link establishing itself between the egg and my consciousness. It wasn’t verbal communication or even clear imagery - more like an instinctual awareness that transcended normal perception.
I could feel the heartbeat of the creature developing inside. The rhythm was slow but powerful, each pulse radiating life force that resonated with my own vampiric bloodline. The connection wasn’t intrusive or controlling - more like becoming aware of a presence that had always been there but was only now making itself known.
Thump... thump... thump...

chapters.title: Chapter 154: The egg hatching
chapters.content:
Chapter 154: The egg hatching
The heartbeat carried emotions alongside its physical sensation. Warmth. Contentment. Recognition. The creature inside knew me somehow, acknowledged me as something significant even before hatching.
The mana fluctuations finally began stabilizing as the transformation completed. The egg settled at its new size, the colors still shifting but no longer creating the chaotic energy surges that had filled the room moments earlier.
I stood there holding the enlarged egg carefully, feeling that mysterious heartbeat connection and trying to process what had just occurred. The Bloodline Evolution Card had clearly worked - meaning the creature’s original bloodline had been Legendary rank and was now elevated to Mythical tier.
Whatever hatched from this egg wouldn’t just be King-rank potential anymore. This was something that could potentially transcend even that limitation, reaching heights that few beasts in history had achieved.
The bond forming between us suggested something else too - this wouldn’t be a simple tamed beast or contracted familiar.
This would be a genuine companion, connected on a level that went beyond normal master-pet relationships.
As the egg settled at its new size and the mana fluctuations finally stabilized, another notification appeared in my consciousness.
[Bloodline Evolution Successful]
[Mysterious Egg bloodline has evolved from Legendary rank to Mythical rank]
[Species potential elevated!]
My eyes widened at the information. The litgle hatchling’s potential was going beyond even King rank, a tier that only a handful of humans in recorded history had ever achieved. The Evolution Card had done far more than just improve the bloodline; it had fundamentally transformed the creature’s ultimate potential.
Before I could fully process the implications, the egg began trembling in my hands.
[Hatching Process Initiated]
Crack... crack... crack...
Fine fracture lines appeared across the vibrant surface, spreading rapidly as the creature inside began breaking free from its shell. Golden light leaked through the cracks, illuminating my darkened room with gentle radiance.
CRACK! Break!
A larger piece of shell fell away, followed by another, and another. The creature inside pushed against the remaining barriers with surprising strength for something just being born.
Finally, the top portion of the egg split completely open.
What emerged made me catch my breath.
A small dragon, no larger than a house cat, tumbled out onto my desk with an adorable lack of coordination. Its scales were a beautiful light blue color that seemed to shimmer with an inner luminescence, like sunlight reflecting off tropical waters.
The dragon looked up at me with impossibly large, round eyes that were a deeper shade of sapphire blue. Those eyes held an intelligence far beyond what newborn creatures typically possessed, studying me with curious fascination rather than fear or confusion.
Rawr! Grrr!
It made a high-pitched sound that was more bird-like than the terrifying roar I associated with dragons. The tiny creature’s wings - delicate, translucent things that looked almost like stained glass fluttered experimentally as it tried to figure out how they worked.
Its body was proportioned in a way that could only be described as adorable. The head was slightly oversized compared to its body, with small horn nubs just beginning to emerge. Its snout was short and rounded rather than the elongated, fearsome shape of adult dragons. Even its claws were tiny and harmless-looking, more suitable for gripping than rending.
Waddle... stumble...
The dragon attempted to walk toward me and promptly tripped over its own feet, tumbling forward in a small ball of blue scales before righting itself with determined effort. It looked up at me again with those huge eyes, seemingly seeking approval or reassurance.
The bond I’d felt through the egg intensified dramatically now that the creature had hatched. I could sense its emotions clearly - curiosity, hunger, and an overwhelming sense of trust directed specifically at me. It recognized me as something important, someone safe and protective.
Grr!
It made the adorable sound again, its tiny tail swishing back and forth with what could only be described as excitement.
I reached out carefully and the dragon immediately climbed onto my hand, its small claws gripping gently as it settled into my palm. It was warm to the touch, radiating body heat.
This impossibly cute creature would one day reach a high rank and become one of the most powerful beings in existence.
But for now, it was just a newborn dragon looking up at me with complete trust and innocent wonder.​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​
I sat on my bed with the tiny dragon still perched in my palm, watching as it explored its immediate surroundings with childlike curiosity.
Every small movement was endearing - the way its tail curled when it was concentrating, how its wings would flutter involuntarily when it got excited, and those impossibly large eyes that tracked everything with keen intelligence.
Pat! Pat!
The dragon gently patted my finger with one tiny claw, as if testing whether I was real. When I moved my finger slightly, it jumped back in surprise before immediately returning to investigate again with fascination.
"You’re going to need food," I said aloud, realizing that newborn creatures
, especially dragons, would have substantial nutritional requirements.
The dragon tilted its head at the sound of my voice, its expression somehow managing to convey both confusion and interest simultaneously.
I mentally reviewed the contents of my storage ring and remembered I still had several beast corpses from recent hunts that I hadn’t yet processed for materials. The storage ring preserved items in their original state, preventing decomposition or decay, which meant the meat would still be fresh.
I reached into my storage and withdrew the body of a forest sloth I’d killed during my early hunting, a Noble-rank beast that should provide adequate nutrition for a newborn
Thud!
The sloth corpse materialized on the floor, and I turned to see the dragon’s reaction.
​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​The tiny creature looked at the offering with what could only be described as absolute disgust.
Its small snout wrinkled, its wings folded tightly against its body, and it actually turned its head away as if personally offended by the presentation.
My mouth dropped open in disbelief before a wry smile formed on my face.

chapters.title: Chapter 155: Little Dragon!
chapters.content:
Chapter 155: Little Dragon!
"Oh boy, you are going to be expensive to feed, aren’t you?"
Hmph!
The dragon made a dismissive sound that somehow conveyed aristocratic disdain despite coming from something the size of a house cat.
Then another realization struck me - I had no idea whether this dragon was male or female. The thought hadn’t even occurred to me during the hatching excitement.
I carefully examined the dragon while it was distracted by ignoring the sloth corpse. After a moment of observation and checking the relevant anatomical features, the answer became clear.
"A girl, then," I confirmed aloud.
She looked at me with those big eyes as if acknowledging the identification, then walked towards the Noble-rank offering before kicking it away with its tiny legs.
"Hey! What are you doing, that’s food. Don’t be wasteful!" I reprimanded it although a soft smile was on my face.
The cute little dragon seemed to wilt at my reprimand which made me feel guilty for doing so.
It’s a few second old child. I need to be more gentle. Sigh, life of a caretaker is really hard.
"Alright, let’s try something better quality," I muttered, returning the sloth to storage and withdrawing an Elite-rank forest boar I’d harvested earlier.
Thud!
The boar corpse appeared, significantly larger and radiating more potent mana than the previous offering.
The little dragon’s demeanor changed immediately. Her head perked up with interest, her nostrils flared as she caught the scent, and she actually took several determined steps toward the meat.
Though her movements still showed some reluctance - clearly this wasn’t ideal quality either - she approached the boar and took a tentative bite.
Nom... nom... nom...
The eating sounds were impossibly cute. Small, delicate bites accompanied by satisfied chirps between mouthfuls.
Her tiny jaws worked relentlessly through the tough meat, and I could see her scales brightening slightly as she absorbed the Elite-rank beast’s nutritional value.
Crunch... nom... chirp!
She paused eating briefly to look up at me, as if seeking approval that she was doing this correctly. When I nodded encouragingly, she returned to her meal with enthusiasm at the prospect of eating.
"So the quality must be at the Elite-rank minimum," I noted with mild exasperation. "At least you’re not demanding Transcendent quality... yet."
Nom nom nom!
The little dragon continued eating with adorable determination, her tail swishing contentedly as she consumed what was probably ten times her current body weight in magical beast meat.
I watched her feast and couldn’t help but smile despite the realization that feeding an Emperor-potential dragon with expensive tastes was going to consume significant resources.
But looking at those big sapphire eyes and listening to those cute eating sounds, I decided it was worth every golden coin it would cost.​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​
If I wasn’t the son of a duke, I would find it difficult to feed this thing. Unless I continuously hunt in the forest, I would never be able to satisfy its hunger.
With the cute little dragon now properly fed and curled up contentedly on my desk, I turned my attention to a practical matter that would solve near future feeding concerns.
I retrieved my communication crystal and contacted the same subordinate who had handled the Thornback nest excavation.
"Young Master Blackwood," his professional voice came through immediately. "How may I assist you?"
"The Thornback corpses your team extracted - I need you to preserve all the meat in stasis. Don’t sell any of it. Keep it fresh using preservation enchantments."
There was a brief pause as Marcus processed the unusual request. Monster meat was typically sold quickly to alchemists or restaurants specializing in magical cuisine, as maintaining large quantities in stasis wasn’t exactly profitable.
To his credit, he didn’t question the order. "Understood, young master. I’ll ensure the meat from all specimens is properly preserved. Shall I arrange for regular deliveries to your location, or would you prefer to collect it personally?"
"Arrange deliveries to this address... Weekly shipments should be sufficient for now."
The address that I gave him was the same mansion I had recently gotten from my daily reward.
"Consider it done. Is there anything else you require?"
"Yes. Keep all the Transcendent Thornback materials - carapaces, venom sacs, specialized organs, everything from the three alpha specimens. Those are not to be sold. Everything else from the Elite-rank spiders can go to market."
"Excellent decision, young master. The Transcendent materials will fetch premium prices, but holding them for personal use or strategic sale timing is far more valuable. I’ll catalog everything and provide you with detailed inventory reports."
"Good. Proceed with selling the Elite-rank materials and send the revenue reports to the family accounting office."
"It will be handled immediately. If I may say so, young master, the total harvest from that operation was extraordinary. The materials alone should generate approximately 150,000 golden coins once processed and sold through proper channels."
That was decent money from a single excavation even by ducal family standards, and it would provide excellent funding for various projects and expenses - including feeding an increasingly expensive baby dragon.
"One final thing," I added. "Discretion regarding these arrangements. The fewer people who know about the meat preservation request, the better."
"Of course, young master. Only essential personnel will be informed, and they are all bound by family confidentiality oaths."
"Thank you. That will be all."
I terminated the connection and looked back at the sleeping dragon, her tiny form rising and falling with peaceful breaths.
Elite and Transcendent-rank meat would keep her well-fed as she grew, and having a steady supply meant I wouldn’t need to constantly hunt just to satisfy her dietary requirements.
The materials from the three Transcendent Thornbacks would also prove valuable for future blacksmithing projects or strategic trades when the right opportunities emerged.
Purr!
The little dragon made a soft sound in her sleep, unconsciously responding to my presence even while resting.
I smiled and gently stroked her small head with one finger, careful not to wake her.
Between the daily reward system, family connections and careful planning, I was building the foundation for challenges I knew were coming - challenges that would require every advantage I could accumulate.

chapters.title: Chapter 156: Changing Star
chapters.content:
Chapter 156: Changing Star
As I continued playing with the little dragon, gently rolling a small ball of condensed mana for her to chase around the desk, something unexpected happened. When I focused my attention on her with genuine curiosity about her capabilities, a translucent panel materialized in my vision.
[Name: Changing Star]
[Race: Dragon]
[Growth Stage: Infant]
[Rank: Elite]
[Potential: ???]
[Skills:]
[Devour - Unique Ability]
Description: A skill that allows the dragon to grow at speeds that transcend any other race. Achieve rapid advancement by consuming the bodies of magical beasts. Growth rate and power absorption directly correlate to the quality and rank of consumed materials.
I stared at the information panel in complete shock, my hand freezing mid-motion as the implications sank in.
"Changing Star," I murmured, testing the name. It suited her somehow, those shifting colors on her scales resembled stars moving across a night sky.
Grrr!
She responded to hearing her name spoken aloud, those big sapphire eyes looking up at me with recognition and pleasure.
But what truly staggered me was the Devour skill. This wasn’t just convenient - this was absolutely overpowered beyond any reasonable balance.
Most magical beasts required years or even decades to advance through ranks, their growth limited by natural cultivation rates and the slow absorption of ambient mana. Even awakened humans with systematic training faced significant bottlenecks between rank advancements.
But this dragon? She could simply eat her way to overwhelming power at speeds that would make legendary cultivators weep with envy.
The skill description said it all - growth that transcended other races. Not "matched" or "rivaled" but actually transcended. And the direct correlation between consumed material quality and advancement meant that feeding her Transcendent-rank meat would accelerate her development exponentially.
"You’re absolutely broken," I said with a mixture of awe and disbelief. "This is genuinely unfair."
Changing Star seemed pleased with my assessment, puffing out her tiny chest as if acknowledging her own superiority.
The status panel also revealed she was already Elite rank despite being literally just hatched. Most newborn creatures started at Noble rank at best, requiring months or years to reach Elite status. She’d apparently absorbed enough energy during development and the bloodline evolution to skip that entire tier.
Her potential showed as question marks, which was simultaneously frustrating and exciting. The system couldn’t calculate her maximum limits, suggesting they exceeded normal measurement parameters. Given that the bloodline evolution had elevated her theoretical cap to Emperor rank, those question marks probably indicated she could surpass even that astronomical ceiling under the right conditions.
"No wonder you turned your nose up at Noble-rank meat," I said, understanding dawning. "Your instincts knew it wouldn’t provide meaningful growth benefits."
Hmph!
She made that aristocratic dismissive sound again, as if vindicated in her earlier rejection of inferior offerings.
I leaned back and processed this revelation. I’d thought acquiring an Emperor-potential companion was already extraordinary, but the Devour skill transformed her from merely powerful to genuinely game-changing.
With unlimited access to high-quality beast materials and feeding, Changing Star could potentially reach Transcendent rank within days rather than months.
King rank within years. And Emperor rank... that timeline was impossible to predict, but it would be measured in years rather than decades.
"You’re going to be terrifying when you grow up," I informed her seriously.
Rawrrr!
She responded happily, completely unaware of or unbothered by the implications of her own overwhelming potential.
I had just hatched possibly the most overpowered creature in existence, and she currently fit in the palm of my hand while making adorable chirping sounds.
The contrast was almost absurd.​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​
Looking at Changing Star as she contentedly explored my desk, a concerning realization struck me. I couldn’t keep her here in the academy dormitory for long - perhaps not even overnight.
The Headmaster and other high-ranking faculty members regularly swept the campus with their mana senses to detect threats or unusual magical signatures. A Mythical-rank dragon, even in infant form, radiated power that would be impossible to completely conceal from someone at their level if they conducted a thorough search.
Discovery would lead to uncomfortable questions I had no good answers for. Where did I acquire a dragon egg? How did I hatch it? Why was its bloodline so extraordinarily pure? The interrogation would be endless and whilst I could evade it with my status it was a hassle and changing star was my ace.
"We need to move you somewhere safer," I told Changing Star seriously.
She tilted her head in confusion, not understanding the concern but trusting my judgment.
The mansion. That was the perfect solution. The property was mine, located outside academy jurisdiction, and had sufficient space and privacy for her to grow without constant oversight. I could set up proper accommodations and ensure regular feeding without arousing suspicion.
The challenge was transporting her there without detection.
I examined my jacket and found a deep inner pocket that would accommodate her small size. "Alright, little one. You need to stay very quiet and still for a while. Can you do that?"
Chirp!
She seemed to understand on an instinctual level, immediately settling into a calm state as I carefully placed her in the pocket. Her warm presence against my chest was reassuring, and I could feel through our bond that she felt safe and protected.
I left my dormitory room quickly, moving with purpose toward the academy gates. The mansion was only about ten minutes away by skateboard - I just needed to avoid any extended conversations or situations that might reveal my hidden cargo.
Footsteps approaching...
"Adrian!"
I recognized Elen’s voice immediately as she appeared in the corridor ahead, clearly having bumped into me by accident. Her expression showed she wanted to discuss something, probably related to the examination results or upcoming training plans.
She reached out to grab my arm in her usual friendly manner.
I swiftly moved away from her grasp with enhanced reflexes, creating distance before she could make contact. Physical contact might disturb Changing Star or cause her to make noise.
"Sorry, Elen. I have urgent business in the city. Can we talk tomorrow?"​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​
Elen’s expression shifted to confusion at my sudden evasive movement, clearly not expecting me to dodge her casual gesture. Her hand hung in the air for a moment before she lowered it, studying my face with curiosity.
But then understanding seemed to dawn - or at least acceptance that I genuinely had something urgent to handle. A smile formed on her face as she nodded.
"Of course. It must be important if you’re rushing out this late. Be careful in the city at night."
"I will. Thanks for understanding."
I felt Changing Star shift slightly in my pocket and immediately coughed to cover the soft sound, turning it into a clearing of my throat.
Elen didn’t seem to notice anything unusual. "See you in class tomorrow then. Good luck with whatever you need to handle."
I nodded and continued past her with measured speed - fast enough to convey urgency but not so rushed as to appear suspicious. Once I was certain she’d headed in the opposite direction, I picked up my pace toward the academy gates.
"Still... stay still..." I whispered softly.
Through our bond, I sent calming reassurance to Changing Star, and she settled back into quiet stillness against my chest.
Just a few more minutes and we’d be at the mansion where she could stretch her wings properly without risk of discovery.​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​
At the academy gates, just as I thought I’d successfully navigated through without further delays, a familiar stoic figure appeared directly in my path.
Emmet.
His intense gaze locked onto me immediately, and he spoke with his characteristic directness.
"Spar."
’Damn it,’ I cursed inwardly. ’Everyone’s suddenly bumping into me tonight.’
Shift...
I felt Changing Star move slightly in my pocket, reacting to my sudden spike of frustration. I needed to end this quickly before she made noise or Emmet’s combat instincts detected something unusual.
"Can’t. Urgent business in the city that can’t wait," I said firmly, already moving past him toward the gates.
Emmet’s expression showed disappointment but also acceptance. He was direct and combat-focused, but he understood when someone genuinely had other priorities.
"Tomorrow then."
"Tomorrow," I confirmed without stopping, passing through the gates and immediately retrieving my skateboard from storage.
Whoosh!
I activated the propulsion system and accelerated toward the mansion, finally free from interruptions and able to focus on getting Changing Star to her new home safely.​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​
Whoosh! Speed!
The skateboard carried me through the darkened city streets at maximum velocity, my enhanced senses keeping watch for any potential followers or observers. The ten-minute journey felt longer than usual with the precious cargo hidden in my pocket.
Finally, the mansion came into view - the elegant white structure standing pristine under moonlight, its empty grounds offering the privacy and security I desperately needed.
I deactivated the skateboard as I approached the entrance, using the key to unlock the main doors and slipping inside quickly. Only after closing and securing the entrance behind me did I allow myself to relax.
"We made it," I said aloud, exhaling deeply in relief.
Chirp!
Changing Star immediately poked her small head out of my pocket, her big sapphire eyes looking around the spacious entrance hall with wonder and curiosity. She’d been remarkably patient during the journey, staying completely still and silent despite probably being uncomfortable in the confined space.
I carefully lifted her out and set her on the polished marble floor. She stretched her tiny wings with obvious satisfaction, shaking herself as if loosening cramped muscles.
Waddle waddle!
She began exploring immediately, her claws clicking softly against the floor as she investigated her new surroundings with characteristic curiosity.
I looked around the empty mansion and smiled with genuine relief. Here, she could grow safely without risk of discovery. No Headmaster conducting mana sweeps, no curious students asking questions, no instructors detecting unusual magical signatures.
This was the perfect sanctuary for an overpowered baby dragon who would one day reach Emperor rank.
"Welcome home, Changing Star."​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​

chapters.title: Chapter 157: Changing Star [2]
chapters.content:
Chapter 157: Changing Star [2]
Changing Star immediately began her exploration of the mansion with adorable enthusiasm, her tiny form waddling from room to room with boundless curiosity.
Patter patter patter!
Her small claws clicked rhythmically against the marble flooring as she moved through the entrance hall, her head swiveling to take in the high ceilings and elegant architecture. Everything was new and fascinating to her freshly hatched senses.
She discovered the grand staircase and attempted to climb the first step with determined effort. Her small legs struggled with the height, and after several failed attempts, she spread her translucent wings and fluttered upward in an awkward half-flight, half-jump that got her to the second step.
She looked back at me with obvious pride at her accomplishment, her tail swishing excitedly.
"Very impressive," I acknowledged with genuine amusement.
Changing Star continued exploring, finding her way to the large reception room I’d been considering converting into a cinema. The open space seemed to delight her, and she attempted an experimental run across the floor before tripping over her own feet and tumbling in a small ball of blue scales.
Roll roll... thud!
She righted herself immediately with a small indignant chirp, as if the floor had personally offended her.
I followed her through several rooms, watching as she investigated corners, sniffed at walls, and occasionally tried to climb furniture that was far too tall for her current size. Her innocent wonder at everything made even empty rooms seem magical through her eyes.
Eventually, I knelt down to her level as she paused to catch her breath after her extensive exploration.
"Changing Star, listen carefully."
rawr?
She looked up at me with those impossibly large eyes, her full attention focused on my words despite not fully understanding language yet.
"This mansion is your home now. You can explore everywhere inside, sleep wherever you want, and make yourself comfortable. But..." I paused to ensure emphasis, "you absolutely cannot leave this place. No going outside, no flying away to explore the city, no wandering off. Do you understand?"
Her response carried a note of confusion mixed with disappointment. She clearly wanted to explore beyond these walls eventually.
I reached out and gently stroked her small head. "It’s for your safety. There are people who would want to capture you or hurt you if they discovered what you are. This mansion protects you. Inside here, you’re safe."
Through our bond, I could feel her processing the emotional weight behind my words even if the specific meaning escaped her. She sensed my genuine concern for her wellbeing and the seriousness of the restriction.
grr.
